name: profligately
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that wastes money, or uses something in a way that wastes it and is not wise : spend profligately We did not spend profligately when we made a profit, so we did not have to cut jobs when the economy got tough. Greenhouse gas emissions have grown so profligately that the task of cutting them back appears almost impossible.
More examplesFewer examplesIn previous years the area grew so much hay that farmers could use it profligately.I do not believe we should be wasting electricity profligately on an unnecessary project.
